Hari Ini, Ketua PSSI Iwan Bule Bertemu Menpora Zainudin Amali
04 Nov 2019, 04:38 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule telah resmi menjabat sebagai ketua Umum Federasi Sepak Bola Indonesia (PSSI) periode 2019-2023. Sekretaris Utama Lembaga Ketahanan Nasional (Lemhanas) berpangkat Komisaris Jenderal ini terpilih dalam Kongres Luar Biasa yang digelar di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Dua hari setelah resmi menduduki kursi nomor satu di PSSI, mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini mulai melakukan kerjanya dengan membangun sinergi dengan pemerintah. Salah satu agendanya adalah bertemu dengan Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali pada Senin, 4 November 2019. "Pertemuan bakal berlangsung pada pukul 14.00 di kantor Kemenpora," kata Sekretaris Kemenpora, Gatot S Dewa Broto melalui keterangan tertulis, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Setelah resmi menjadi nakhoda PSSI, Iwan Bule berjanji membentuk tim kelompok kerja (pokja) untuk menjalankan Instruksi Presiden (Inpres) Nomor 3 Tahun 2019 tentang Percepatan Persepakbolaan Nasional. "Kami akan membentuk tim pokja berkaitan dengan Inpres itu minggu depan," kata dia di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Menurut Iwan Bule, pokja tersebut akan berkoordinasi dengan kementerian dan lembaga yang tercantum dalam Inpres yang ditandatangani Presiden Joko Widodo pada 25 Januari 2019 itu.
Pria berusia 57 tahun tersebut ingin Inpres tersebut segera terwujud dalam tindakan nyata demi mendongkrak prestasi sepak bola nasional. "PSSI harus menjemput bola. Inpres itu sejak dikeluarkan sampai sekarang belum berjalan. Jadi harus ada percepatan," tutur Iwan.
Terkait Inpres tersebut, mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini berterima kasih kepada Presiden Joko Widodo yang memberikan perhatian khusus kepada sepak bola. Memang, dari semua cabang olahraga yang ada di Indonesia, hanya sepak bola yang memiliki Inpres.
"Baru di zaman Pak Joko Widodo pemerintah mengeluarkan Inpres khusus untuk sepak bola. Instruksi itu melibatkan banyak kementerian dan lembaga yang melakukan peran masing-masing untuk meningkatkan kualitas sepak bola Indonesia," kata Iwan.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali sudah meminta kepada pengurus baru PSSI hasil pemilihan dalam KLB PSSI, Sabtu (2 November), untuk segera membuat peta jalan (road map) sepak bola Indonesia. "Setelah kongres selesai, kami berharap PSSI bersama KONI, KOI dan Kemenpora duduk bersama untuk menjawab perintah Inpres tersebut," ujar Zainudin.

IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
Today, PSSI Chairwoman Iwan Bule Meets Menpora Zainudin Amali
Nov 04 2019, 04:38 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Rina Widiastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule has officially served as chair of the 2019-2023 Indonesian Football Federation (PSSI). The Principal Secretary of the National Defense Agency (Lemhanas), who was appointed as Commissioner General, was elected at the Extraordinary Congress held at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Two days after officially occupying the number one seat at PSSI, this former Metro Jaya Police Chief began to do his work by building synergy with the government. One of the agendas is to meet with the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali on Monday, November 4, 2019. "The meeting will take place at 14.00 at the Ministry of Youth and Sports," said the Secretary of the Ministry of Youth and Sports, Gatot S Dewa Broto through written statements, Monday, November 4, 2019.
After officially becoming the captain of PSSI, Iwan Bule promised to form a working group team (pokja) to carry out Presidential Instruction (Inpres) No. 3 of 2019 concerning the Acceleration of National Football. "We will form a working group team with regard to the Inpres next week," he said at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
According to Iwan Bule, the working group will coordinate with the ministries and institutions listed in the Presidential Instruction signed by President Joko Widodo on January 25, 2019.
The 57-year-old man wants the Inpres to be immediately manifested in concrete actions to boost national football achievements. "PSSI has to pick up the ball. Since the Presidential Instruction was issued until now it has not been running. So there must be an acceleration," said Iwan.
Related to the Presidential Instruction, the former Metro Jaya Police Chief thanked President Joko Widodo for paying special attention to football. Indeed, of all sports in Indonesia, only football has Inpres.
"It was only in the era of Pak Joko Widodo that the government issued a special Presidential Instruction for football. The instruction involved many ministries and institutions that carried out their respective roles to improve the quality of Indonesian soccer," Iwan said.
Previously, the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali had asked the new management of PSSI the results of the election in the PSSI KLB, Saturday (November 2), to immediately make a road map for Indonesian soccer. "After the congress is over, we hope that PSSI together with KONI, KOI and Kemenpora sit together to answer the instructions of the Inpres," said Zainudin.

IRSYAN HASYIM
